alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 11:26PM CDT until June 18 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT FOR BRYAN...SOUTHEASTERN COAL AND ATOKA COUNTIES... At 1126 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles north of Daisy to 6 miles southeast of Lane to near Albany, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Durant measured a 61 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Atoka, Caddo, Bokchito, Achille, Stringtown, Lehigh, Bennington, Tushka, Caney, Kemp, Hendrix, Blue, Lane, Utica, Wardville, Daisy, Albany, Atoka Reservoir, Wade, and Chockie. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
